question: Which of the following Indian cities became the first in South Asia to introduce the Heat Action Plan?
explanation: The first Heat Action Plan (HAP or Plan) was prepared in 2013 by the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) with help of Indian Institutes of Public Health (IIPH), national and international academic experts and learning from global best practices on early warning systems and heat adaptation. With this initiative, Ahmedabad became the first Indian city to introduce the Heat Action Plan to tackle the “Heat Wave” and “Severe Heat Wave” conditions. The Indian Meteorological Department defines heat wave as an increase of 5 degrees Celsius above the normal maximum temperature.
